Text: The implications for fairness and equity would be that applicants who are part of the local group get an advantage thats not based on their actual creditworthiness. This could lead to less qualified applicants getting approved over more qualified ones who arent part of the group. It might also create a disparity in approval rates between groups, which could be seen as unfair, even if its not illegal. Additionally, if the local affiliation check is intended to promote community support or inclusion, but the way its implemented doesnt consider other factors that contribute to credit risk, it could result in suboptimal risk management.
